details.title: Nature's accessibility to Chinese scientists
details.abstract: The first reference to China in Nature appeared on page 25 of the issue of Thursday 1 November 1869-the journals first issue. For well over a decade, Natures staff in the Asia-Pacific region have been keeping in close touch with scientists and policy makers in China, while both my predecessor, John Maddox, and I have placed China high on our list of priorities. I am convinced that the Chineseg overnment will continue to appreciate the importance of science to the countrys future development in terms of the countrys intellectual standing, growing economy and the conditions of its people. I will be delighted if Nature can help sustain that sense of national priorities by helping to enhance the international and domestic profile of Chinese science.
